thread.title: Mustangs Lose Thrilling Five-Set Match to No. 5 Pittsburgh
thread.title_full: Mustangs Lose Thrilling Five-Set Match to No. 5 Pittsburgh

author: BVM Sportsdesk
title: Mustangs Lose Thrilling Five-Set Match to No. 5 Pittsburgh
text:
Mustangs Lose Thrilling Five-Set Match to No. 5 Pittsburgh
The No. 11 Mustangs lost a hard-fought match to No. 5 Pittsburgh, falling in five sets (20-25, 25-23, 19-25, 25-18, 9-15) during their ACC home opener. SMU drops to an 8-3 record, while Pittsburgh improves to 9-2. Malaya Jones led the Mustangs with 23 kills, showcasing significant performance despite the defeat. Although SMU out-blocked Pitt 13-9 and recorded more aces (9 to 6), the Mustangs struggled with a .187 hitting percentage compared to Pitt's .294. The match featured competitive back-and-forth action, with each set presenting distinct momentum shifts throughout.
- Malaya Jones recorded 23 kills, hitting .422.
- Averi Carlson distributed 47 assists along with five digs and two aces.
- SMU is 2-1 in five-set matches this season.
- Pittsburgh has now secured a 2-1 series advantage in their matchups with SMU.
- Malaya Jones has had double-digit kills in eight matches this season.
SMU will face No. 5 Pittsburgh again on Sunday, September 28, aiming for redemption in Pittsburgh. The Mustangs will look to capitalize on lessons learned from this closely contested match.
Bottom LineDespite the loss, SMU displayed resilience and competitive spirit, particularly through standout performances by Jones and Carlson. The Mustangs need to improve their attack efficiency to secure future victories against top-ranked teams.
Read more at SMU Athletics
